controller
Class JointRelation

java.lang.Object
  controller.JointRelation
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
 class JointRelation
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Class to hold various information about joins and relation to each other and the other actions in sequence.

Author:
Levi Lindsley

Interpretation

JointRelation

JointRelation(Pair j,
              Euclidean pointOne,
              Euclidean pointTwo)
The constructor called by Gesturecontroller.addPoint();

Parameters:
J1 - : SimpleOpenNI constant for a joint
J2 - : SimpleOpenNI constant for a joint
x - : x relationship between J2 and J1
y - : y relationship between J2 and J1
z - : z relationship between J2 and J1
conn - : Is this concurrent with the next action in sequence, should not be true for last action

setPrev

void setPrev(Pair p)
Sets the previous value this is found after the JointOne and JointTwo are know so it is called after the constructor but could be included in the constructor at a later time.

Parameters:
p - : The value to set previous to

equalJoints

public boolean equalJoints(JointRelation o)
Determines if two instances have the same Joint locations used for finding the previous value

Parameters:
o - : Another P class to compare to
Returns:
True if BOTH joints in this and o are equivalent

equalsCoordinates

public boolean equalsCoordinates(JointRelation o)
Determines if two instances have angular locations that are within Epsilon of each other

Parameters:
o - : Other instance to compare to
Returns:
True if angles along all axes are equivalent where this.X == o.X && this.Y == o.Y && this.Z == o.Z +- Epsion.
